intro: Valerianella eriocarpa var. plagiocyathus, commonly known as the hairy valerian, is a flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its aromatic foliage has been used historically in herbal remedies for its calming properties.
